trans-unit.source: Represents the formatting and style information applied to individual cells within a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> class lets you share style information across multiple <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> cells, rows, columns, and row or column headers, avoiding the memory requirements of setting style properties on individual cells.

For more information about classes that have a property of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> and how they relate to each other, see [Cell Styles in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/cell-styles-in-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> class using default property values.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> class using the property values of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> used as a template to provide initial property values.
dataGridViewCellStyle is `null`.
Gets or sets a value indicating the position of the cell content within a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewContentAlignment"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewContentAlignment.NotSet"></xref>.
The property value is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewContentAlignment"></xref> value.
Applies the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.ApplyStyle%2A> method applies the values of the properties that are set in the `dataGridViewCellStyle` parameter to the current <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle>.
If a property is not set in `dataGridViewCellStyle`, the current <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> retains its value of that property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to apply to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref>.
dataGridViewCellStyle is `null`.
Gets or sets the background color of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of a cell.
The default is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Creates an exact copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that represents an exact copy of this cell style.
Gets or sets the value saved to the data source when the user enters a null value into a cell.
The user can enter a null value into a cell by pressing CTRL+0 or by typing the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue%2A> property.

When the user commits the change, the underlying cell value is set to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> property or to `null` if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> is <xref:System.DBNull.Value?displayProperty=fullName> and the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ValueType%2A> is a reference type.
This conversion does not occur when you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Value%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property programmatically.

The control does not display the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue%2A> property value for cell values equal to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> property value when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> is set to a value other than <xref:System.DBNull.Value?displayProperty=fullName> or `null`.

In this case, you can handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting?displayProperty=fullName> event to display the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue%2A> property value.
For more information, see the code example in this topic.
The value saved to the data source when the user specifies a null cell value.
The default is <xref href="System.DBNull.Value"></xref>.
Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equivalent to the specified object.
An object to compare with this instance, or `null`.
`true` if o is a and has the same property values as this instance; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the font applied to the textual content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell.
You can use this property to change the typeface styles applied to the cell text.

Because a <xref:System.Drawing.Font> is immutable (its properties are read-only), you can modify this property only by assigning a new or existing <xref:System.Drawing.Font> to it; you cannot alter the properties of the returned object directly.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> applied to the cell text.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the foreground color of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.ForeColor%2A> property typically should specify a color that contrasts with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.BackColor%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the foreground color of a cell.
The default is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the format string applied to the textual content of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.Format%2A> property specifies how cell values are formatted as strings.
For more information, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md).
A string that indicates the format of the cell value.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the object used to provide culture-specific formatting of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell values.
An <xref href="System.IFormatProvider"></xref> used for cell formatting.
The default is <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentUICulture"></xref>.
Serves as a hash function for a particular type.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue"></xref> property has been set.

Use this property to determine whether the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> property has been explicitly set without having to store its default value for comparison.

This is useful because the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> property has a non-empty default value, unlike most other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> properties, which have default values such as `null`, <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Empty>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewContentAlignment.NotSet>.
`true` if the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue"></xref> property is the default value; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.FormatProvider"></xref> property has been set.

Use this property to determine whether the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.FormatProvider%2A> property has been explicitly set without having to store its default value for comparison.

This is useful because the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.FormatProvider%2A> property has a non-empty default value, unlike most other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> properties, which have default values such as `null`, <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Empty>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewContentAlignment.NotSet>.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.FormatProvider"></xref> property is the default value; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue"></xref> property has been set.
Use this property to determine whether the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue%2A> property has been explicitly set without having to store its default value for comparison.

This is useful because the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue%2A> property has a non-empty default value, unlike most other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> properties, which have default values such as `null`, <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Empty>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewContentAlignment.NotSet>.
`true` if the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue"></xref> property is the default value; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell display value corresponding to a cell value of <xref href="System.DBNull.Value"></xref> or `null`.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> cell with this cell style has a value of <xref:System.DBNull.Value?displayProperty=fullName> or `null` or the user edits the cell and presses CTRL+0, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control displays the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue%2A> property value.

When a user edits a cell with this cell style and enters the value of this property or presses CTRL+0, the control sets the cell value to the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> property or to `null` if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> is <xref:System.DBNull.Value?displayProperty=fullName> and the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ValueType%2A> is a reference type.
This conversion does not occur when you set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Value%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property programmatically.

The control does not display the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue%2A> property value for cell values equal to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> property value when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.DataSourceNullValue%2A> is set to a value other than <xref:System.DBNull.Value?displayProperty=fullName> or `null`.

In this case, you can handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting?displayProperty=fullName> event to display the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.NullValue%2A> property value.
For more information, see the code example in this topic.
This property takes any object, which enables you to specify a value with a type appropriate to the display type of the cell.
For example, you can set this property to string values for use by text box cells or images for use by image cells.
The object used to indicate a null value in a cell.
The default is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the space between the edge of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> and its content.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.Padding%2A> property affects where the editing control of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> is drawn.

For example, if you set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.Padding%2A> on a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell> to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding?displayProperty=fullName> that has a value of 10 for its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Left%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Top%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Right%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Padding.Bottom%2A> properties, the content of the cell is drawn in the middle of the cell with a space of 10 pixels between the edges of the text box and the edges of the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Padding"></xref> that represents the space between the edge of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> and its content.
Gets or sets the background color used by a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell when it is selected.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of a selected cell.
The default is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the foreground color used by a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell when it is selected.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.SelectionForeColor%2A> property typically should specify a color that contrasts with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.SelectionBackColor%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the foreground color of a selected cell.
The default is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets an object that contains additional data related to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref>.
An object that contains additional data.
The default is `null`.
Returns a string indicating the current property settings of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref>.
A string indicating the current property settings of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref>.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether textual content in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> cell is wrapped to subsequent lines or truncated when it is too long to fit on a single line.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.WrapMode%2A> is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState.False> for a cell that contains text, the cell displays the text on a single line, and displays any embedded newline characters as box characters.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.WrapMode%2A> is <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState.True> for a cell that contains text, the cell displays newline characters as line breaks, but also wraps any lines that exceed the width of the cell.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState.NotSet"></xref>.
The property value is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState"></xref> value.
Creates an exact copy of this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> instance is cast to an <xref:System.ICloneable> interface.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that represents an exact copy of this cell style.
